actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned pursuant to a previous special order. The next meeting is scheduled for 10:00 a.m. on September 29, 2023.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Grothman moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.

The Chair appoints the following conferees on H.R. 2670 in lieu of their appointments on September 19, 2023: From the Committee on Financial Services, for consideration of subtitle J of title X of Division A, secs. 1085 and 1086, title LXVIII of Division E, Division I, and Division J of the Senate amendment, and modifications committed to conference: Mr. McHenry, Mr. Luetkemeyer, and Ms. Waters. Agreed to without objection.
Mr. Womack asked unanimous consent that when the House adjourns today, it adjourn to meet at 10:00 a.m. on September 29. Agreed to without objection.
The Clerk was authorized to correct section numbers, punctuation, and cross references, and to make other necessary technical and conforming corrections in the engrossment of H.R. 4665.
The Clerk was authorized to correct section numbers, punctuation, and cross references, and to make other necessary technical and conforming corrections in the engrossment of H.R. 4367.
The Clerk was authorized to correct section numbers, punctuation, and cross references, and to make other necessary technical and conforming corrections in the engrossment of H.R. 4365.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.actionItem: The Chair announced that the unfinished business was the question on adoption of amendments which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
The House resolved into Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union for further consideration.

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 4665 — "Making appropriations for the Department of State, foreign operations, and related programs for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2024, and for other purposes."
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of September 28.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.
Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union rises leaving H.R. 4665 as unfinished business.
On motion that the committee rise Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Diaz-Balart moved that the committee rise.

At the conclusion of debate on the Burgess amendment No. 78, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Diaz-Balart demanded a recorded vote, and the Cha ir postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 723, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Burgess amendment No. 78.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Burgess,  numbered 78 printed in Part D of House Report 118-216 to reduce foreign assistance to certain countries based on the number of unaccompanied alien children who entered the US from those countries.

At the conclusion of debate on the Massie amendment No. 77, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Diaz-Balart demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 723, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Massie amendment No. 77.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Massie,  numbered 77 printed in Part D of House Report 118-216 to prevent funds made available by this Act from being used to transfer cluster munitions to any foreign country.

At the conclusion of debate on the Ogles amendment No. 76, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Ogles demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 723, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Ogles amendment No. 76.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Ogles,  numbered 76 printed in Part D of House Report 118-216 to prohibit the use of funds to delist the Iran Revolutionary Guard Corps as a Foreign Terrorist Organization.

At the conclusion of debate on the Perry amendment No. 74, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote announced that the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Lee (CA) demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 723, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Perry amendment No. 74.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Perry,  numbered 74 printed in Part D of House Report 118-216 to prohibit any funds from being made available for the United Nations Relief and Works Agency.

At the conclusion of debate on the Steube amendment No. 73, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote announced that the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Lee (CA) demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 723, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Steube amendment No. 73.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Steube,  numbered 73 printed in Part D of House Report 118-216 to ensure none of the funds made available by this Act may be used to provide assistance to the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO).

At the conclusion of debate on the Davidson amendment No. 71, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote announced that the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Lee (CA) demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 723, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Davidson amendment No. 71.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Davidson,  numbered 71 printed in Part D of House Report 118-216 to reduce the salary of Victoria Nuland, Acting United States Deputy Secretary of State and Under Secretary for Political Affairs, to $1.

At the conclusion of debate on the Roy amendment No. 70, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote announced that the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Lee (CA) demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 723, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Roy amendment No. 70.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Roy,  numbered 70 printed in Part D of House Report 118-216 to prevent funds appropriated by this Act from being used to implement the administrations climate change Executive orders.

At the conclusion of debate on the Tenney amendment No. 69, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote announced that the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Tenney demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 723, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Tenney amendment No. 69.
An amendment, offered by Ms. Tenney,  numbered 69 printed in Part D of House Report 118-216 to prohibit funds to move the U.S. Embassy in Israel out of Jerusalem.
On agreeing to the Tenney amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 723, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Tenney amendment No. 68.
An amendment, offered by Ms. Tenney,  numbered 68 printed in Part D of House Report 118-216 to reduce the salary of the Special Envoy to Iran Robert Malley to $1.

At the conclusion of debate on the Burchett amendment No. 67, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote announced that the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Lee (CA) demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 723, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Burchett amendment No. 67.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Burchett,  numbered 67 printed in Part D of House Report 118-216 to prohibit funds from being used for the Special Presidential Envoy for Climate.
On agreeing to the Burchett amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 723, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Burchett amendment No. 66.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Burchett,  numbered 66 printed in Part D of House Report 118-216 to prohibit funds from being used for the Art in Embassies program.

At the conclusion of debate on the Burchett amendment No. 65, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Lee (CA) demanded a recorded vote, and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 723, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Burchett amendment No. 65.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Burchett,  numbered 65 printed in Part D of House Report 118-216 to reduce the salary of the Deputy Chief Executive Officer at the US Agency for Global Media to $1.
The House resolved into Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union for further consideration.

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 4665 — "Making appropriations for the Department of State, foreign operations, and related programs for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2024, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate on the H.R. 5692, the Chair put the question on passage of the bill, and by voice vote announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Calvert demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House proceeded with 30 minutes of debate on H.R. 5692.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 5692, H.R. 4365 and H.R. 4367. The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 5692, under a closed rule. The resolution provides for 30 minutes of general debate on the bill H.R. 5692 and one motion to recommit. The resolution provides that further consideration of H.R. 4365, the further amendments specified in section 3 shall be considered as adopted and the resolution provides for further consideration of H.R. 4367, the further amendment specified in section 5 shall be considered as adopted.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 730. H.R. 5692 — "Making supplemental appropriations for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2024, and for other purposes."
Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union rises leaving H.R. 4665 as unfinished business.
On motion that the committee rise Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Calvert moved that the committee rise.

actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 730.

Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 730 — "Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5692) making supplemental appropriations for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2024, and for other purposes; providing for further consideration of the bill (H.R. 4365) making appropriations for the Department of Defense for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2024, and for other purposes; and providing for further consideration of the bill (H.R. 4367) making appropriations for the Department of Homeland Security for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2024, and for other purposes."
Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union rises leaving H.R. 4665 as unfinished business.
On motion that the committee rise Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Diaz-Balart moved that the committee rise.

At the conclusion of debate on the Burchett amendment No. 64, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Lee (CA) demanded a recorded vote, and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 723, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Burchett amendment No. 64.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Burchett,  numbered 64 printed in Part D of House Report 118-216 to reduce the salary of the Chief Management Officer at the US Agency for Global Media to $1.

At the conclusion of debate on the Burchett amendment No. 63, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Lee (CA) demanded a recorded vote, and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 723, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Burchett amendment No. 63.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Burchett,  numbered 63 printed in Part D of House Report 118-216 to reduce the salary of the Special Assistant to the Director of Programming at Voice of America to $1.
On agreeing to the Issa amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 723, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Issa amendment No. 62.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Issa,  numbered 62 printed in Part D of House Report 118-216 to prohibit funding for negotiations toward renewing the US-China Science and Technology Cooperation Protocol.

At the conclusion of debate on the Foxx amendment No. 61, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Foxx demanded a recorded vote, and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 723, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Foxx amendment No. 61.

An amendment, offered by Ms. Foxx,  numbered 61 printed in Part D of House Report 118-216 to prohibit the State Department from using taxpayer funds to send employees to any event or conference hosted by the Clinton Global Initiative.
On agreeing to the Hageman amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 723, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Hageman amendment No. 59.

An amendment, offered by Ms. Hageman,  numbered 59 printed in Part D of House Report 118-216 to prohibit State Department Remote Work Agreements which allow a domestically assigned employee's alternative worksite to be located outside of the locality pay area of the regular worksite.

At the conclusion of debate on the Hageman amendment No. 58, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Lee (CA) demanded a recorded vote, and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 723, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Hageman amendment No. 58.
An amendment, offered by Ms. Hageman,  numbered 58 printed in Part D of House Report 118-216 to prohibit funds from being made available for the State Department's Office of Global Change.

At the conclusion of debate on the Spartz amendment No. 57, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Lee (CA) demanded a recorded vote, and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 723, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Spartz amendment No. 57.
An amendment, offered by Mrs. Spartz,  numbered 57 printed in Part D of House Report 118-216 to prohibit funding for United Nations entities unless specifically appropriated in the underlying bill.
On agreeing to the Mooney amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 723, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Mooney amendment No. 56.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Mooney,  numbered 56 printed in Part D of House Report 118-216 to prohibit economic support funds from being obligated or expended to Mexico under Chapter 4 of Part II of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961.
On agreeing to the Boebert amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 723, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Boebert amendment No. 55.
An amendment, offered by Mrs. Boebert,  numbered 55 printed in Part D of House Report 118-216 to ensure no funds to enforce or implement a COVID-19 vaccine mandate for international travelers.

At the conclusion of debate on the Gooden (TX) amendment No. 54, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Lee (CA) demanded a recorded vote, and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 723, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Gooden (TX) amendment No. 54.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Gooden (TX),  numbered 54 printed in Part D of House Report 118-216 to prohibit taxpayer dollars from funding the International Organization for Migration's "Refugee Travel Loan Program."
On agreeing to the Gooden (TX) amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 723, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Gooden (TX) amendment No. 53.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Gooden (TX),  numbered 53 printed in Part D of House Report 118-216 to prohibit funding to implement the Global Compact for Safe, Orderly and Regular Migration.

At the conclusion of debate on the Ogles amendment No. 51, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Jackson Lee demanded a recorded vote, and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 723, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Ogles amendment No. 51.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Ogles,  numbered 51 printed in Part D of House Report 118-216 to prohibit funds in this Act from being made available to Pakistan.

Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 723, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Boebert amendment No. 50.
An amendment, offered by Mrs. Boebert,  numbered 50 printed in Part D of House Report 118-216 to decrease the salary of Palestinian affairs officer George Noll to $1.

Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 723, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Boebert amendment No. 49.

An amendment, offered by Mrs. Boebert,  numbered 49 printed in Part D of House Report 118-216 to decrease the salary of Department's Acting Chief Diversity and Inclusion Officer Constance Mayor to $1.

At the conclusion of debate on the Boebert amendment No. 47, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Lee (CA) demanded a recorded vote, and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 723, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Boebert amendment No. 47.
An amendment, offered by Mrs. Boebert,  numbered 47 printed in Part D of House Report 118-216 to decrease the salary of UN Ambassador Linda Thomas Greenfield to $1.

At the conclusion of debate on the Gaetz amendment No. 46, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Lee (CA) demanded a recorded vote, and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 723, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Gaetz amendment No. 46.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Gaetz,  numbered 46 printed in Part D of House Report 118-216 to prohibit funds from being used to implement the Paris Agreement.

At the conclusion of debate on the Steube amendment No. 45, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced the nays had prevailed. Mr. Staube demanded a recorded vote, and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 723, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Steube amendment No. 45.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Steube,  numbered 45 printed in Part D of House Report 118-216 to prohibit funds from being used to provide assistance to Iraq.

At the conclusion of debate on the Steube amendment No. 44, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced the nays had prevailed. Mr. Steube demanded a recorded vote, and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 723, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Steube amendment No. 44.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Steube,  numbered 44 printed in Part D of House Report 118-216 to prohibit funds from being used for the Lebanese Armed Forces.

Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 723, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Greene (GA) amendment No. 43.

An amendment, offered by Ms. Greene (GA),  numbered 43 printed in Part D of House Report 118-216 to prohibit funds from being used by the Secretary of State to initiate a drawdown and delivery of defense articles and services from Department of Defense stocks to Ukraine.

An amendment, offered by Ms. Greene (GA),  numbered 41 printed in Part D of House Report 118-216 to reduce the salary of Amanda Bennett, Chief Executive Officer of the United States Agency for Global Media, to $1.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Kelly (MS),  numbered 27 printed in Part D of House Report 118-216 to reduce funding by $10,000,000 for the Global Environment Facility Fund.

At the conclusion of debate on the Ogles amendment No. 23, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Lee (CA) demanded a recorded vote, and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 723, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Ogles amendment No. 23.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Ogles,  numbered 23 printed in Part D of House Report 118-216 to transfer $14.3 million from the Peace Corps budget to the Spending Reduction Account.

At the conclusion of debate on the Perry amendment No. 22, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Lee (CA) demanded a recorded vote, and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 723, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Perry amendment No. 22.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Perry,  numbered 22 printed in Part D of House Report 118-216 to eliminate funding for Migration and Refugee Assistance.

At the conclusion of debate on the Perry amendment No. 20, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Diaz-Balart demanded a recorded vote, and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 723, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Perry amendment No. 20.

At the conclusion of debate on the Perry amendment No. 18, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Lee (CA) demanded a recorded vote, and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.

At the conclusion of debate on the Gaetz amendment No. 17, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Lee (CA) demanded a recorded vote, and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 723, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Gaetz amendment No. 17.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Gaetz,  numbered 17 printed in Part D of House Report 118-216 to reduce funds apportioned to USAID by $4.5 billion and transfers to the Spending Reduction Account.
On agreeing to the Jackson Lee amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 723, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Jackson Lee amendment No. 16.

An amendment, offered by Ms. Jackson Lee,  numbered 16 printed in Part D of House Report 118-216 to increase by $1,000,000 and decrease by $1,000,000 the Global Health Programs account to highlight and support the fight against the practice of Female Genital Mutilation.

At the conclusion of debate on the Perry amendment No. 15, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Diaz-Balart demanded a recorded vote, and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 723, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Perry amendment No. 15.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Perry,  numbered 15 printed in Part D of House Report 118-216 to eliminate funding to the U.S. Agency for International Development, Funds Appropriated to the President Capital Investment Fund.

At the conclusion of debate on the Crane amendment No. 13, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Diaz-Balart demanded a recorded vote, and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 723, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Crane amendment No. 13.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Crane,  numbered 13 printed in Part D of House Report 118-216 to reduce funding by 50% for USAID.

At the conclusion of debate on the Crane amendment No. 10, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Lee (CA) demanded a recorded vote, and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.

At the conclusion of debate on the Crane amendment No. 8, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Lee (CA) demanded a recorded vote, and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Crane,  numbered 8 printed in Part D of House Report 118-216 to eliminate funding to the United States Institute of Peace.
On agreeing to the Diaz-Balart amendments; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 723, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 20 minutes of debate on the Diaz-Balart amendment en bloc.

Amendments en bloc  offered by Mr. Diaz-Balart,  comprised of the following amendments printed in Part D of House Report 118-216 as en bloc: Nos. 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 12, 19, 21, 24, 32, 33, 34, 35, 37, and 52.
The Committee of the Whole proceeded with one hour of general debate on H.R. 4665.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Jennifer A. Kiggans to act as Chairwoman of the Committee.
House resolved itself into the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union pursuant to H. Res. 723 and Rule XVIII.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 4365, H.R. 4367, H.R. 4368 and H.R. 4665. The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 4365, H.R. 4367, H.R. 4368, and H.R. 4665, under a structured rule for each bill. The resolution provides for one hour of general debate for each bill and one motion to recommit.

Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 723. H.R. 4665 — "Making appropriations for the Department of State, foreign operations, and related programs for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2024, and for other purposes."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Good of VA to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Glenn Thompson to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
